alert.note: Alert for Park (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 8:37PM MDT until August 07 at 10:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Colorado, including the following county, Park. The heaviest rainfall was just south and southwest of Lake George. * WHEN...Until 930 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry gulches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 837 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lake George.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
